column3: str
Always a pleasure to greet a new customer. Something I can do for you, friend?
Your friend's garnered a fair bit of attention, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Suppose it's the novelty. Some folk haven't ever seen a Lalafell. Anyway, what'll it be?
You meet all sorts of people in this line of work. Good, bad─they've all got their reasons. You too, I suppose.
Suppose I ought to reinforce the doors in case the good ser thinks to grace us with his presence once more...
Shame Mistress Tataru had to move on. Had grown rather accustomed to having her around.
And there I thought we'd have to make do without her! Don't know how long she'll stick, but we're glad to have her back.
Some folk just can't let go of the past, whereas others can't wait to bury it.

We've got a collection going for the families that lost their homes. Might surprise you to learn that a good many contributions come from the Brume. Not that they can spare much, but they know better than anyone up above how rough it is down below.
Raise a glass to the lost, and we poor bastards who can't forget them. Aye, I know─it was a foolish plan, doomed from the start. But there ain't a man here who doesn't understand.
...Never heard of a peace conference ending with a mob chanting for someone's death. Gods help us if we hold a third.
...They've come, have they? Well, don't you worry about me and mine. I can still wield a blade if the battle spills into the city.
When I heard the Horde was at the gates, I let folk take shelter here at the Knight. Those were a tense few hours─even a few cups of wine couldn't dull the edge of fear for some...
And then came the news of your victory over Nidhogg. My ears still ring from the deafening cheer that went up from every throat in the room. I swear they meant you to hear it out there on the bridge!
Recently, the call went out for able hands to help rebuild, and a bunch of our regulars took up the cause. When I find a moment, I'll take them a little something to wet their whistle.
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
What kind of place is this?
Nothing.
Being that it's my tavern, I suppose I can do whatever I please. For the most part, I dispense drinks and advice, as the situation warrants.
Wasn't always so. I did my duty, took my wounds, and hung up my shield, as did the owner before me. You might call it a tradition.
They say that the ser who built this tavern was happy to be forgotten. “Rather serve ale instead of steel.” Had a way with words, he did─and with women. But that's a story for another time.
Of all the taverns in all of Ishgard, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> walks into mine...
And there I was thinking you already knew...
The Forgotten Knight is just another place for travelers and locals alike to partake of food and drink.
Upstairs, you're like to find more well-to-do regulars mingling with travelers. Downstairs, well, that's where you'll find the locals.
Right or wrong, people have a habit of sticking with their own, and Ishgardians are no different.
They've got different tastes, to say the least, but we try to cater to them all as best we can.
